Experience Senior Database Administrator Intel Corporation May 2005  – Present (10 years 4 months) Chandler, Arizona Intel IT Senior Database Administrator - Responsible for the maintenance, performance tuning, system upgrades, and continuous improvement for as many as 210 critical manufacturing, process engineering and yield enginering databases on both Microsoft SQL 2005 and Oracle 10g and Oracle11g. Experienced with large oracle RAC 10G and 11G database administration as well as Oracle Dataguard and Oracle Active Dataguard (HA) environments. Extensive experience with SQL tuning, performance analysis and performance improvements. Oracle Certified Administrator (OCA) and Oracle Certified Professional (OCP) for Oracle 10G. IT Software Engineer Intel Corporation July 2000  –  May 2005  (4 years 11 months) Chandler, Arizona Intel IT Automation - Owner of Yield Analysis Databases and Yield Analysis/Engineering Analysis software for an advanced manufacturing facility. Working with process engineering, defect engineering and manufacturing to interface complex metrology equipment with factory automation systems. Driving continuous improvement and break fix solutions for Yield and Engineering analysis tools and systems for 5 cutting edge manufacturing facilities. Developing utilities with unix shell scripting, perl, awk and sed to automate recovery procedures and monitor various aspects of system performance. Defect/Yield Engineering Intel Corporation July 1995  –  July 2000  (5 years 1 month) Chandler, Arizona Maintaining and calibrating advanced metrology equipment and working with vendors to drive maintenance and continous improvement measures. 
Identifying key defect modes within the manufacturing line and driving defect reduction efforts with Process Engineering and Yield Engineering. Managing a group of 8 advanced defect technicians responsible for all metrologly inspections, experiment execution and material dispositions within the factory. 
Responsible for complex data extraction, analysis, and reporting from multiple "Big Data" data sources utilizing SAS, Advanced Oracle SQL, and various data aggregation utilities. Training new technicians. Summary If you hear anyone saying "I am enjoying my life" or "Life cannot be better" or "Better than any day" or "No complaints with life", most certainly the owner of that voice is Murthy Upadhyayula. 
 
Yes. It is me. 
 
Started my career in financial sector and gradually climbed the management ladder that enabled me to manage HR, Accounting, Prevention of Frauds and Embezzlement in financial sector, Employee Associations, Customer service and supervising performance of Board of Directors of State level banks, their policies, financial soundness and ascertaining their eligibility to continue in the business. 
 
My interest in Computer technology during early 1990 started my self-learning process. The change avert office environment forced me to perform all activities right from consuming the idea to production deployment and support which in turn made me expert in Software Architecture, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Test Life Cycle, Production Support, Technical Documentation, postmortem, product transition, sustainability, disaster recovery, Capacity Planning and above all Do's and Don'ts. 
 
Working for Intel is an education in itself. Five years with Manufacturing automation excelled me in execution with efficiency, New Business Group trained me with the agility needed to succeed. My experience in building teams and managing projects gave the cutting edge of identifying right people for right job at the right time. 
 
After 30 years of career, I am as disciplined, enthusiastic, motivated, energetic and happy as I was on my first day of employment. I am sure I will be the same on my day of retirement. 
 
Currently working on my book "Engineering Management to success". I plan discussing tips to successfully managing projects, evaluating managers (not the employees), motivate employees, thinking out of the box in a traditional environment. providing tools to find right person for right job, successful project management, etc. Murthy's corner: June 2014 Edit Summary If you hear anyone saying "I am enjoying my life" or "Life cannot be better" or "Better than any day" or "No complaints with life", most certainly the owner of that voice is Murthy Upadhyayula. 
 
Yes. It is me. 
 
Started my career in financial sector and gradually climbed the management ladder that enabled me to manage HR, Accounting, Prevention of Frauds and Embezzlement in financial sector, Employee Associations, Customer service and supervising performance of Board of Directors of State level banks, their policies, financial soundness and ascertaining their eligibility to continue in the business. 
 
My interest in Computer technology during early 1990 started my self-learning process. The change avert office environment forced me to perform all activities right from consuming the idea to production deployment and support which in turn made me expert in Software Architecture, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Test Life Cycle, Production Support, Technical Documentation, postmortem, product transition, sustainability, disaster recovery, Capacity Planning and above all Do's and Don'ts. 
 
Working for Intel is an education in itself. Five years with Manufacturing automation excelled me in execution with efficiency, New Business Group trained me with the agility needed to succeed. My experience in building teams and managing projects gave the cutting edge of identifying right people for right job at the right time. 
 
After 30 years of career, I am as disciplined, enthusiastic, motivated, energetic and happy as I was on my first day of employment. I am sure I will be the same on my day of retirement. 
 
Currently working on my book "Engineering Management to success". I plan discussing tips to successfully managing projects, evaluating managers (not the employees), motivate employees, thinking out of the box in a traditional environment. providing tools to find right person for right job, successful project management, etc. Murthy's corner: June 2014 Edit If you hear anyone saying "I am enjoying my life" or "Life cannot be better" or "Better than any day" or "No complaints with life", most certainly the owner of that voice is Murthy Upadhyayula. 
 
Yes. It is me. 
 
Started my career in financial sector and gradually climbed the management ladder that enabled me to manage HR, Accounting, Prevention of Frauds and Embezzlement in financial sector, Employee Associations, Customer service and supervising performance of Board of Directors of State level banks, their policies, financial soundness and ascertaining their eligibility to continue in the business. 
 
My interest in Computer technology during early 1990 started my self-learning process. The change avert office environment forced me to perform all activities right from consuming the idea to production deployment and support which in turn made me expert in Software Architecture, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Test Life Cycle, Production Support, Technical Documentation, postmortem, product transition, sustainability, disaster recovery, Capacity Planning and above all Do's and Don'ts. 
 
Working for Intel is an education in itself. Five years with Manufacturing automation excelled me in execution with efficiency, New Business Group trained me with the agility needed to succeed. My experience in building teams and managing projects gave the cutting edge of identifying right people for right job at the right time. 
 
After 30 years of career, I am as disciplined, enthusiastic, motivated, energetic and happy as I was on my first day of employment. I am sure I will be the same on my day of retirement. 
 
Currently working on my book "Engineering Management to success". managing Complex IT projects with cross-functional, geo-diversified (offshore) teams (Open) 8 projects Launch Professional Services The objective was to make 25 Subject Matter Experts to be available to all of Intel developers and operations teams as one... Capacity planning after considering data retention period, source data size, destination data size after transformation process etc.
